newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HKFE's Philadelphia currency options link delayed.
newsitem.headline: HKFE's Philadelphia currency options link delayed.

text.p: The Hong Kong Futures Exchange's (HKFE) planned linkage with the Philadelphia Stock Exchange to trade currency options products has been delayed by U.S. market regulators, said HKFE chief executive Ivers Riley.

"We now know the regulatory situation in the U.S. is going to keep that going a bit slower than we had hoped and therefore we have move it back on our schedules," Riley told a news conference on Thursday.
"We are going to attach priority now on our linkage work to our the NYMEX linkage," he said.

The linkage with New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX), which would allow NYMEX precious metal and energy products to be traded by members of HKFE through their electronic trading system NYMEX ACCESS, was expected to start in late March or early April, Riley said.
HKFE earlier said the linkage with Philadelphia, giving currency traders the opportunity to trade Philadelphia Stock Exchange currency options on the HKFE, was expected to start by the end of 1996.
However, Riley said the delay in the plan was not fatal but procedural from the regulatory side in the United States.
